text:
That last bite can do you in. Read this if you’re post op:

After bariatric surgery, your stomach isn’t just smaller, it’s a whole new system. That “one more bite” you used to get away with?

It can now leave you feeling:
⚠️ Nauseated
⚠️ Bloated
⚠️ Miserable for hours
⚠️ Or even throwing up.

That tiny pouch is trying to signal: “I’m full!”
But if you override that signal, out of habit, guilt, or not wanting to waste food it can lead to dumping syndrome, pain, or worse…

🧠 Your surgery changed your anatomy. Now it’s time to retrain your brain.
✅ Slow down.
✅ Chew thoroughly.
✅ Pause between bites.
✅ And when you feel satisfied, STOP.

That last bite isn’t worth the discomfort, regret, or setbacks.

👇 If you’ve ever had to lay down after eating or felt miserable from one too many bites, comment “NEVER AGAIN” below — you’re not alone.
